channel.title: /biz/ Active (filtered, with replies)
channel.description: Filtered out: general, gme, bbbyq. OP + first 3 replies + last 30 replies.

item.title: Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us? — 50 replies — 200.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us?

Open thread • Replies: 50 • Updated: 2026-02-18 17:25 UTC

OP

You guys in the EU make less than us on paychecks, but you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare and PTO while we have to pay for private insurance which chronically denies people's health situations.

Are people saying that starting a business in the EU is difficult because of the regulations? What regulations does the European union impose on its citizen's than they think it's easier to start in the United States instead?

Early replies (first 3)

61860815
>>61860796
Depends enormously on which country are we talking about. Some are easy (Germany) some are very hard (Italy)

61860817
>>61860796
> you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare
yeah right
good luck getting that "universal healthcare" if you're not a boomer, waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure. It's either you go private (and pay out of your own pocket) or you die
> and PTO
oh wow, 20 wagie cagie free days a year. Totally worth the 60%+ taxes.

All taxation is theft. It's just that. Taxation doesn't pay for services. It's just the way they control the economy, and here in EU they fucking LOVE to control what you can and cannot do. They print the money, they don't need to tax you. They tax you to control you (and to humiliate you)

61860822
>>61860796
The healthcare thing is too much american leftie argument, it also has been very overcrowded by you guessed arabs and africans, unironically I was better treated when I broke my leg in brazil of all places then in france

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61861441
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure.
Yeah, I remember waiting decades for my appendicitis, it rupturing and me dying because of it. Thankfully they could keep me alive for months despite the extreme difficulties this poses.

>>61861032
We need more unified European regulation. Sadly the EU is not an economic alliance anymore.

61862545
>>61860796
>>61860860
I love how hard it is to even talk about european economy on reddit, not because of europeans, but because of american lefties, if you so much, and most times you don't even need to, mention the US, they will flock like a horde to claim the US lies about everything, that 30% of americans are unemployed and nearly no one in europe, the EU is literal worker's paradise and how much they love their welfare policies and hate the US greed, its quite hilarious really how much they want a nanny state.

61865504
It is, soon it will was once EU Inc comes into play

61865623
>>61860796
>you have universal healthcare
yea but you have to wait 1 year+ because there is a million niggers in queue before you

61865645
>>61861057
Lol this is true.
Germany and France made the EU suck with their shit like GDPR etc. Spain happily sniffs every turd. The rest aren't better.

61866460
If your efforts are starting to go anywhere, your own government will make sure, you won't get any further.
They hate nothing more than citizens that are not dependent on them. That's why they are allowing third world people in to the maximum extent physically possible, that are never going end up being a "plus" on the balance sheet, but that they hope will be cheap voting sheep for their party. The people pay for them after all, not the party.
Effectively: If Elon Musk was a citizen of a EU-country, he'd already be in jail waiting for the sentence to be sent to prison. You probably don't want to get into that situation.

61866966
>>61865645
>Le GDPR sucks because uhm JUST LET ME HAVE YOUR DATA

61867520
>>61861071
It’s also as easy in my country (Finland)

61867536
>>61860796
>you get to keep more money
Except they have to pay more in taxes to wait in line for months whole muslim refugees who didnt pay go before them kek. Europeans are so dumb its unreal.

61867540
>>61860796
italy here.
50% tax is ok ?
this is shITALY

61867547
>>61860796
It's literally impossible to build any meaningful sized company in Europe because the entire E.U. is designed to prevent anyone from competing with the aristocratic class and the privately held billion dollar company their great great grandfather built in 1870.

61867554
>>61860842
YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE TALKING ABOUT

61867577
Europe has no tech industry because German rich fags were afraid to pay coders more than traditional engineers because then car engineers would ask for more money so they just fucked all of Europe and let America and China run everything.

61868041
>>61860796
No, in some places is actually easy, I remember playing a game in class one time in uni to look regulations for business worldwide, there's almost no difference whatsoever in european and american regulations, sometimes american regulations are actually worse and the accumulated taxes from city, state, federal can surpass european taxes. The only conclusion we could draw was that europeans were just lazy and too laidback, they have so much welfare that there's no rush or anxiety with ending up destitute and homeless so they just don't bother with the hazzle of building a business. They are better off just being on benefits or unemployed, most business there predate the big social welfare network just because of a need to survive really and complacency in changing what already works, they are much much better off.

61868110
>>61867547
>>61867577
that's bullshit but i believe it

61868167
>>61867602
rip Sbarro

61868190
>>61868041
this is actually hilarious

61868222
>>61868190
Mostly sad, americans either are prosperous or starve

61869496
>>61868041
>They are better off just being on benefits or unemployed
Can confirm, although it's currently also due to absolutely no one fucking hiring, because Germany is fucked beyond reasonable short-term hope.
It's also really troublesome to do any kind of work-like activities while on benefits, because that could easily cause the termination of those.

61869942
>>61868041
Can confirm. I enjoy 9,5 weeks of yearly paid leave. Salary is decent, I won't be a billionaire but I don't care, I have more free time that I know what to do with. Planning my next Japan trip on my current free time btw.

61869994
>>61866966
gdpr is extra annoyances for everyone + it doesn't even protect my data, you faggot, SO WHAT WAS THE FUCKING POINT OF IT ALL EXCEPT TO HUMILIATE THE FUCKING CITIZEN????

61870065
>>61860815
>Germany is easy
That's a joke right? Germany is literally the country that shaped modern bureaucracy into the hellpit it is today. Post WW II Germans made it a mission to have everything under control, documented and organized so they can ensure something like this doesn't happen again. It's deeply engrained in every aspect of their life.

61870103
>>61865645
mug GDPR. Just go for legitimate use and document what your pseudonymyze and no one cares anymore lmao. add a random mail address for right to forget, and done.

I personally launched a company (real, doing > 500k€ arr) in France, enjoyed JEI status and CIR/CII credits, and we even have the bpifrance hack that gives you no string attached loans to boost any equity fundraise you make (can give you 500k-1M€ in addition to a raise),

what it means? basically Macron created loopholes to reduces taxes and increase funding indirectly, with these shit, because boomers are blocking any real reforms

Macron tried it seems, and also the pool of talent is better here for high level stuff, which seem to be the next decades. No one needs medium fullstack coders or general engineers, we need experts and this is what this country produces

61870110
>>61870065
They liked to thoroughly document shit during and before WW2 as well. It wasn't some post war re-awakening

61870164
>>61869994
>gdpr is extra annoyances for everyone
Just don't collect data for commercial purposes
>it doesn't even protect my data
It does but not allowing certain monetization strategies of the data, informing you about how, which and why what points of data are used and giving the EU a mechanism to fight against, mostly foreign, companies violating your privacy.

61870191
>>61870164
did you read anything of what i said there and ignored it or are you just retarded?
>Just don't collect data for commercial purposes
as a user, having to click on shit on every website for gdpr is annoying

>It does but not allowing certain monetization strategies of the data, informing you about how, which and why what points of data are used and giving the EU a mechanism to fight against, mostly foreign, companies violating your privacy.
yeah you definitely are retarded. which part of "it does not protect my data" did you not understand?

61870199
starting a business is very easy on both sides of the atlantic. scaling is harder in the EU because it's a fragmented market with wildly different rulesets between member states and capital markets

61870203
>>61870191
>as a user, having to click on shit on every website for gdpr is annoying
Oh the horror! Let me guess, in most cases you just have to click 'disable all' and 'save' right? Here's a pro-tip to save you the time: Block the domain or script they use for their cookie banners
>which part of "it does not protect my data" did you not understand?
The part where you lied.

61870682
>>61870203
ah, i see, you are retarded. just because some laws that are lax exist doesn't mean data is protected, you fucking retarded faggot

item.title: Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop?? — 29 replies — 116.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop??

Open thread • Replies: 29 • Updated: 2026-02-18 17:29 UTC

OP

Are there ANY good job boards left besides fucking LinkedIn by Microslop??

Early replies (first 3)

61864202
LinkedIn is complete dogshit so I guess not.

61864249
>>61864195
I got my job off a posting on Handshake

61864299
>>61864195
I honestly don't believe anyone is getting jobs on linkedin anymore. Nobody.
I tried almost 2 years and sent hundreds upon hundreds of applications.
Fake jobs.
AI fake recruiters.
All bullshit man.
I got my job off a local job board finally.
LinkedIn has only one use to find you a job: post to your hundreds of connections asking if anyone can refer you to a job. It's a networking site.
I add the maximum number of connections every week in my industry targeted at companies I might want to work for in the future.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61864306
>>61864195
LinkedIn is full of indians

61865108
>>61864249
handshake.firm

61865182
Believe it or not, careerbuilder. it’s jam packed with indians but once a week I got a good lead from a mag7 recruiter and one of them hired me

61865294
>>61864195
80% of job openings are fake and just HRM wasting everyone's time.
19.999999% of jobs go to nepo hire scum, so you never had a chance anyways.

61865452
>>61864195
>job boards
Head hunters are the new meta. Have fun competing with 20000 AI resumes in every application tho lol

61865518
>>61864195
Yes. However they are private job boards for your colleges. My college has it's own job board for students and alumni and most of the postings there I've noticed are not on LinkedIn or Indeed. Game is pay to play, it's cringe. Sorry bro.

61865532
That being said even that isn't that helpful since those postings just take you to the hiring companies website where you still run into the same problems of competing with h1b pennies on the dollar wagies and having your resume filtered by ai to look for certain keywords and interviewing with fat liberal women.

61867272
>>61865518
>>61865532
God why does job hunting have to be the ultimate humiliation ritual.

>start a business!

Sure. If I was more smart and clever and had any ideas.

61867329
>>61864195
When I see a job posting on linkedin or some other gay job board I go to the company's website and apply there directly instead.

61867359
>>61864195
yes put your resume here many people get jobs from /biz/

61867416
>>61865452
hey [full legal name] yo mate whatsup I am Jake Andrews and just saw your profile in one of my specialized searches. I am based out of London and studied exercise sport science and use my unique background to help connect outgoing engineers like yourself find awesome jobs. I got an amazing career opportunity as [random skill you marked on linkedin] at this awesome up and coming company based out of flyover town USA. Salary is competitive but I won't tell you!

61867477
Right now it seems like the only way to get one through connections. No one is hiring.

61867912
In Ireland, recruiters are actually pretty good and you can build a network through them. Unfortunately I'm not in Ireland now and all Irish jobs are hybrid. European based roles naturally require working fluency in another language and that's a bridge too far at the moment, even though I speak 3 other languages to various degrees

LinkedIn seems to be quite tricky to stand out through even with customised CVs (via AI) for every application.

Unfortunately, competition and noise are both high. Personal connections are still far and away your best option (if they are an option)

61867924
Indeed is full of scam postings, so not that.

I've tried welcometothejungle.com for applying to remote jobs, but since they're remote, don't really expect to get an interview - competition is still sky high since everyone's laid off now. Job market's totally fucked all around, so any workarounds you might find are already oversaturated. Sorry.

61867934
>>61864195
I've just passed the second round of interviews for two different jobs, both off of LinkedIn. I don't know of any others that are really comparable.

61867939
>>61864195
>by Microslop
Holy retard

61867948
>>61867939
>t. Microshart "employee"

61867952
>>61867948
>Microsoft made Linkedin even doe it was made 14 years prior to its acquisition

61867956
>>61867934
maybe this time there'll be a real job eventually
this time

61868130
>>61867912
bullshit, in Ireland I block all agencies because all they want is to waste time

61869656
>>61864195
The biggest mistake people ever made was thinking Lindickin was useful to begin with.

61870591
>>61864195
Just use the companies website directly lol.

61870680
>>61867952
Ah yes, as it's infamously well known that no company ever makes changes to its products after undergoing the M&A process.

61870686
>>61867956
If you get to the second round where you’re actually going on site it’s a real job. Although it’s not like you’d know anything about that from Mommy’s basement

61870690
>>61867924
I actually got my current job from Indeed shortly after starting the search, it's chill and pretty good, but I'm an engineer so your mileage may vary

61870699
>>61864195
the only good ones are invite only, I got my invite from a relative

61869014
>>61868918
>>61868957
Actual rich people in NYC use a loophole where their building/unit is somehow tied to a much lower valued building on the same block.
So a penthouse they bought for $50M has a paper value of like $500k.

Anyone who thinks the wealthy actually gets shafted by tax increases and that the politicians they own won't leave loopholes open for them, not just in NYC but in pretty much every western country, are absolutely delusional.
Taxing the rich is just a convenient excuse politicians use to raise taxes with the peasants blessings.

61869016
>>61868898
I can't believe anyone actually lives in NYC. Genuinely.

61869109
>>61869016
seriously, at least in california the weather and landscape makes it worth it.

61869172
>>61869016
what, you don't like being stabbed by niggers in the subway??

61869185
Who cares? What they're doing is great for the poor. All poor socialists need to move to NYC ASAP and take advantage of the New New York. We should all be buying them bus tickets.

61869354
>>61868918
When you go to a restaurant, you are paying their property taxes and when you pay rent you are paying the property owners property taxes.

This is one level of abstraction so if you cannot understand this it would indicate that your IQ is extremely low.

61869533
>>61868898

Just goes to show how horrible the Republican candidate must have been that THIS was the better choice.
One of the main reasons Trump was elected was because the Democratic candidates were THAT bad (unlikable women both times)

61869557
>>61869533

Mummy Dummy just told retard Dem New Yorkers what they wanted to hear. It's literally out of a 4th grader playback for school elections.

Biden wanted to run again, and after that absolutely disastrous debate against Trump. Harris was the VP but never was she going to win against a man who survived an assassination attempt.

61869669

Mr. Kabbalah bracelet Mamdani is a trap for retard brown libs.

61869813
>>61869669
> islamicist loves jews

61870037
>>61868957
Why would they not? If your landlord could charge 10% more for rent and not lose tenants, he’d already be charging 10% more for rent.

61870052
>>61869014
>the politicians they own
damn if only there was something that could be done about it

61870136
This is being (((misreported))) pretty hard. The property tax increase 'announcement' is contingent on the governor rejecting a 2% municipal tax on individuals making over 1m/yr, which is bad for people using the loophole someone else mentioned of property tax avoidance. The property tax increase is a statement of the downstream effects of not implementing the proposed tax on high-income earners.

If you're someone who truly believes they can cut $20B out of the budget instead of raising taxes, name the departments which should be cut, their current size, and what the impact of that would be

61870232
>>61869014
>Taxing the rich is just a convenient excuse politicians use to raise taxes with the peasants .
This.
ALL taxes are ALWAYS paid by the middle class and upper middle class.
People who can't either pretend they are poor,
or people who can't hire accountants that rich hire.

these all dumped except for VICI which has a massive 5Y crab

the city will cease to exist in its current form

item.title: Oldfags on this board... what was it like hunting for a job in 2021-2022 ? — 34 replies — 65.2/hr
item.content:encoded:
Oldfags on this board... what was it like hunting for a job in 2021-2022 ?

Open thread • Replies: 34 • Updated: 2026-02-18 17:06 UTC

OP

>be me
>zoomer wagie stuck in application hell
>look at the linkedin of every mid-level manager/engineer at FAANG/Fortune 500
>notice a pattern
>literally every single one of them (mostly jeets/chinks) got hired between 2020-2022 while I was still in high school
>mfw

Is it just me or was the bar literally on the floor back then? What was the "process" even like for you dinosaurs? Did you just walk in, pulse check, firm handshake, and get handed a 250k TC package with stock options?

Explain to me how you guys actually got hired during the infinite money glitch era without sounding like you just got lucky.

Early replies (first 3)

61868988
>>61868983
they reached out to me from LinkedIn and asked me to interview. I interviewed with them, passed the interview and then they hired me. They asked me to fill out the job application paperwork after I already did a few interviews to "make it official". Then I got an offer for close to 400k TC and took it.

61869002
>>61868983
Nobody wanted to work because covid relief was so good. You could make more on unemploymenr than working and you could put off paying a lot of your bills. Getting a job was easy if you wanted one.

61869003
>>61868983
I graduated with a degree in Physics in December 2019. Covid hit early 2020. I worked at a gas station for 4 months before getting factory work. I worked on the factory floor for all of covid, and only got a job in my field in 2023. It was hell.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61869024
It's not the timing, it's because they're Indian.

61869068
>>61868983
>Job hunting in 2021 is oldfag status
>mfw when 40

61869072
>>61868983
I graduated a year before covid and the company I work for basically had a policy where they didn't hire new grads that didn't graduate before covid.

61869094
got a random email one day asking me if I wanted to join their company, no resume or anything, and thats where I am today

61869113
>>61868983
I started applaying for a new job in jan 21 and in april i landed a new one with 50% increase. After a few months i started applying again and in 22 i got a remote job with almost 100% salary increase and a more favourable taxation. This kind of leap is the easiest early in your career, it gets much more difficult later.

61869617
>>61869023
This. I took that first $120k position and ran with it. I worked my other job too though so $120k + $75k. The job laid off 30% of the company in a year though.
>>61868983
It was crazy, multiple recruiters in your DMs on linkedin a day. Always got an interview if you applied. Everything was remote nearly and good pay. Feels like you were the hot HS QB for a year then you graduated, got fat and forgotten about. I went to get my PhD in the mean time.

61869636
>>61868983
i'm an accountingfag not a techfag. that said, the job market in 2021 was very good. at the time i only had 3 YOE and i would get like 15-20 recruiter messages a month. i interviewed all over for remote jobs. today, even with more experience and several promotions to management, i'm lucky to get like 5 recruiter messages a month and all of the jobs sound like shit (remote is rare.)

61869678
>>61869636
CPA here
Governmentmaxxing
Pensionmaxxing
Comfymaxxing

Biggest challenge in government is once you bet high enough, you’re working closely with elected officials who have totally different perspective than normal people

61869716
>>61868983
There was a massive wave of boomers taking retirement then and companies got caught with their pants down because they hadn't hired and trained anyone in decades so yeah they hired literally anyone including zoomers and the wave of indians out of panic.

61869731
>>61869678
ive looked at government jobs. i wouldnt dream of working fed govt after trump fired millions of fed workers. state/local pay sucks unless youre at like the director level, but remote is rare and is always subject to some niggerfaggot politician demanding all government wagies return to the wage cage so as to pump jewish commercial real elstate bags.

61869734
>>61868983
it was already fucked by 2020 and saturated with jeet nepo
the age of waltzing into a tech job with minimal skills and walking away rich was 90s-2016

61869736
>2021 makes you an oldfag
Not for /biz/ specifically, but I wonder what these zoomers and alphoomers would think of us that have been around since like 2012
I still remember being called a newfag back then too

61869892
>>61868983
>What was the "process" even like for you dinosaurs? Did you just walk in, pulse check, firm handshake, and get handed a 250k TC package with stock options?
Yes

61869908
>>61869002
I manage a lot of part-time people and at the time I had a few ask me to limit their hours so they could collect partial unemployment. it was a ridiculous time.

61869996
>>61868983
It was really easy to pump up your salary every month by switching job. Currently stuck since the market got so shit. Not mad since im still profiting. (IT fag)

61870040
I still had to apply to a lot of places. Most of the places avidly hiring were shittier companies or contract roles. But I did get to vault to senior level status after only 4 years of junior because of the demand. Salary went from $78k to $126k total and I got to be fully remote. LinkedIn/Indeed were still fully useable for applications.

Being in tech though the interview process was still shit, multi panel stuff and lots of calls and back and forth with many companies. Not too dissimilar from now except people were more eager to talk to you. I do have almost 10 years experience though so maybe that's why I'm still getting bites these days.

61870357
>>61869731
I’m not fed. Am director. Not remote is accurate although some places do hybrid.

61870415
>>61868983
it was really nice man, lots of recruiters in your DMs all the time asking you to interview and you could leverage it pretty easily
now it's shit compared to back then but hopefully the pendulum swings back at some point

61870471
>>61868983
build something that shows dedication and that you give a fuck. doesn't need to be groundbreakingly useful, just something that took effort and that's presentable. also don't use any LLM in your resume and communication whatsoever, everyone who's literate will notice and everyone hates reading LLM slop by now. this + not being a complete shut-in will still get you hired if you're not too picky.

61870483
>>61868983
It's as hard as it is today, I barely sent 10 applications back then and got into a fortune 50 because I had good internships and references not even nepo.
I did have to do math that was probably an IQ test, videos, on-site interviews with hiring managers, tech team, etc... an before that I had idk how many calls with HR.
Most people I know just pray and spray their CVs.
Competent and socially adjusted people are the rarest thing there is.
Stop dooming and apply yourself. Literally

61870489
>>61869678
>you’re working closely with elected officials who have totally different perspective than normal people
what do you mean by different perspective?

61870490
>>61870471
>+ not being a complete shut-in
it's over

61870535
2020-2021 was ok but I remember 2017-2019 being incredibly easy when you were looking for a job

61870547
People talk about AI ruining the job market but it was already rock bottom by around 2017. My past job hunts took 900 and 1200 applications each. AI is actually a benefit for zoomers now since you can even the odds a bit. Automate all those cover letters and application forms.

61870567
>>61870547
six figure software engineer btw

61870579
haven't had to look for a job since 2007.

t. 43 yo Boomer

61870581
>>61868983
people who got hired in 2020-2022 are the first to get laid off

61870584
>>61869002
>Nobody wanted to work because covid relief was so good.
uh maybe if you compare it to minimum wage work. not a software job lol

61870600
>>61870547
It recovered by 2021 though

61870608
>>61870600
only because of cheap covid money

ID probably changed because mac addr recycle, but I appreciate the effort post anon
While the bad faith posters will inevitably harvest some portion of loosh from me, as I still retain my (admittedly damaged) spirit, my comments are not necessarily for direct reply: they are also for those passive scrollers and anons who have visited this site for years and never typed a single reply or started a single thread. The silent lurkers, for which any morsel of knowledge may enlighten or ease their spiritual burden by a miniscule amount, is to whom I make these comments hidden far away from the mass of crowds who trample all over fragile truth for vulgar and banal platitudes. Godspeed, anon. We will meet again for certain, but will never know it.

We have *real* mexican food for cheap, no bad weather, and as many asian women and big booty latinas as you could ever want.

61864183
>>61862380
D.C. has long been "Hollywood for ugly people." It's where ugly people go to make it - with their 6 figure bullshit government job.
I lived in Fairfax and worked in Arlington - at least I wasn't on the nigger side of the Potomac.

61864233
>>61858975
>>61858982

I’m convinced the only places left on earth where it’s still possible to safely and comfortably raise a family on a middling firstie income are Southeast Asia and Eastern Europe (the Catholic ones in the EU not the orthodox shitholes)

61864442
>>61864233

Can confirm it's comfy as fuck here with just a few hundred grand of wealth.

61864757
>>61862146

61864780
>>61858975
most of those cities suck ass and are basically open air prisons for white collar wageslaves. people with money "in LA" live on or near the beach. people with money "in DC" live in surrounding areas like bethesda or chevy chase.

61864816
>>61858975
I enjoy Manhattan and visiting SOCAL but living there would be too much. I lived on in Santa Monica for a year and anytime you'd want to do something you had to plan around traffic. Not a way to live you entire life. There's a ton of great nature in southern California so even if you're not into le hustle and bustle you're still able to have a good time.

61868506
>>61858975
wow gringos are really fucking retarded, who gives a fuck about your shitty cities??

61869839
>>61858975

There's no surplus of 20-29 year old white women in LA.

61869848
>>61861595
NIGGER THIS IS THE COSTCO IN MONTGOMERY VILLAGE MD, GTFO MY VILLAGE NIGGA LONG LIVE 9 RUGA GANG FOR LIFE. LOVE LIVE TAY, FREE BIG AHK. FUCK GTOWN

61869882
These are places for people who already got rich to move to. Who became the main character in the vast opportunities available elsewhere starting from little.

Poor people and wagies who immediately move there are actually doomed to a lifetime of NPC servitude. You are the background noise and lifeless bodies that the actual rich main characters have to step around in their new map. You just think you're a main character because you're proximal to them.

61870054
>>61859145
>BIG PLACE GOOD
That's it? That's your argument?
>>61859324
The chud memes are exaggerated, but the economic reality for the vast majority of people is that living in a major metro is basically impossible unless you live like a fucking rat with a hald dozen roommates. Big cities are full of rich people not because that's how you get rich and make connections, but because they're the only ones that can afford to live there. And the wealth and connections come naturally, when you have lots of rich people together. Big cities are effectively playgrounds for the top 20%, and open air prisons for the rest who work 3 wagie jobs and still can't afford rent or utilities and live to serve their rich masters.

If you're already rich then you're right: nothing beats a major primary city. More contacts and networking, more opportunities, more fun, more wage slaves to pleasure you. Secondary and tertiary, smaller cities are potentially good for middle income people.
